designScenario.name: V H F Radio System
designScenario.description: The V H F Radio System is a critical avionics subsystem enabling short-range voice and data communication between aircraft and air traffic control (ATC). Designed for robust operation in electromagnetic environments, it supports digital voice transmission, automatic frequency tuning, and redundancy to ensure uninterrupted communication during flight. The system adheres to advanced aviation standards, integrates with cockpit digital systems, and incorporates environmental monitoring to maintain reliability under varying conditions.

details.description: Enable secure, bidirectional voice communication with ATC and adjacent aircraft via the 118-137 MHz band using AM modulation.
Support Controller-Pilot Data Link Communications (CPDLC) for text-based messaging over VHF Digital Link (VDL) Mode 2.
Achieve end-to-end communication latency below 30ms for real-time voice and CPDLC message delivery.
Maintain bandwidth efficiency of 25 kHz per channel with adaptive frequency hopping to mitigate interference.
Implement triple modular redundancy (TMR) across transceiver modules to ensure operation under single or dual component failures.
Automatically isolate faulty subcomponents and switch to redundant paths within 500ms of failure detection.
Meet RTCA/DO-178C (software) and DO-254 (hardware) certification standards for airborne systems.
Operate reliably within temperature ranges of -55°C to +70°C and withstand 14g peak acceleration.

systemComponents.name: VHF Transceiver
systemComponents.description: Primary hardware module for transmitting and receiving voice/data signals. Integrates digital signal processing and adaptive filtering.

subComponents.name: RF Front End
subComponents.description: Handles signal amplification, filtering, and antenna interface with automatic gain control.

subComponents.name: Digital Modem
subComponents.description: Performs AM modulation/demodulation and VDL Mode 2 data framing.

subComponents.name: Frequency Synthesizer
subComponents.description: Generates precise VHF frequencies with ±0.005% accuracy for channel selection.

systemComponents.name: Control and Redundancy Manager
systemComponents.description: Manages transceiver operations, redundancy switching, and interfaces with aircraft systems.

subComponents.name: FPGA-Based Voting Logic
subComponents.description: Implements TMR consensus for critical subsystem outputs.

subComponents.name: Flight Management Interface
subComponents.description: Coordinates with the Flight Management System (FMS) for frequency tuning and priority messaging.

systemComponents.name: Power Distribution Unit
systemComponents.description: Provides isolated power rails with voltage regulation and fault isolation for critical components.

systemComponents.name: Antenna Assembly
systemComponents.description: Optimized for omnidirectional coverage with built-in lightning protection and moisture sealing.

systemComponents.name: Environmental Monitoring Module
systemComponents.description: Monitors temperature, vibration, and humidity to trigger adaptive operational adjustments.

relationships.description: The Control Module configures transceiver parameters and receives status telemetry via a dedicated digital bus.
The Control Module requires stable 28V DC power with hot-swappable redundancy from the Power Unit.
The Antenna is a physically integrated component of the transceiver's RF path.
Environmental data feeds into the Control Module to adjust operational parameters dynamically.
The Control Module exchanges flight plan data and priority channel assignments with the FMS.

attributes.name: Operating Frequency Range
attributes.description: Complies with ICAO allocated channels for ATC and aircraft communications.

attributes.name: Transmission Power
attributes.description: Adjustable power output to balance range (up to 200 NM) and regulatory limits.

attributes.name: Receiver Sensitivity
attributes.description: Ensures reception of weak signals in high-noise environments.

attributes.name: Redundancy Level
attributes.description: Three independent processing chains to achieve ASIL-D safety integrity level.

attributes.name: Latency Target
attributes.description: Guaranteed end-to-end delay for mission-critical voice/data packets.

attributes.name: Compliance Standards
attributes.value: RTCA/DO-178C Level A, DO-254 Level A, MIL-STD-461G
attributes.description: Certification for airborne software, hardware, and electromagnetic compatibility.

comments.body: Critical avionics subsystem supporting ATC communication with triple redundancy and digital CPDLC capabilities.
